rev.diff:
Line 154: Line 154:
:''are gifts to those who seek every opportunity to decry Islam and ridicule Muslims and can only exacerbate a situation in which Muslims and the Western media seem to be locked in an ever-descending spiral of ignorance and mutual loathing.''<ref>[http://www.theamericanmuslim.org/tam.php/features/articles/wikipedia_and_depictions_of_the_prophet_muhammad_the_latest_inane_distracti/0015659 Wikipedia and Depictions of the Prophet Muhammad: The Latest Inane Distraction], 10 February 2008</ref>
:''are gifts to those who seek every opportunity to decry Islam and ridicule Muslims and can only exacerbate a situation in which Muslims and the Western media seem to be locked in an ever-descending spiral of ignorance and mutual loathing.''<ref>[http://www.theamericanmuslim.org/tam.php/features/articles/wikipedia_and_depictions_of_the_prophet_muhammad_the_latest_inane_distracti/0015659 Wikipedia and Depictions of the Prophet Muhammad: The Latest Inane Distraction], 10 February 2008</ref>
â
Wikipedia considered but rejected a compromise that would allow visitors to choose whether to view the page with images.<ref name="NY"/> The Wikipedia community has not acted upon the petition.<ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/technology/2008/feb/17/wikipedia.islam?gusrc=rss&feed=worldnews Wikipedia defies 180,000 demands to remove images of the Prophet] ''[[The Guardian]]'' 17 February 2008</ref> The site's [[Talk:Muhammad/FAQ|answers to frequently asked questions about these images]] state that Wikipedia does not censor itself for the benefit of any one group.<ref>[http://www.informationweek.com/news/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=206106192 Wikipedia Refuses To Delete Picture Of Muhammad] ''[[Information Week]]'' 7 February 2008.</ref>
+
Wikipedia considered but rejected a compromise that would allow visitors to choose whether to view the page with images.<ref name="NY"/> The Wikipedia community has not acted upon the petition.<ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/technology/2008/feb/17/wikipedia.islam?gusrc=rss&feed=worldnews Wikipedia defies 180,000 demands to remove images of the Prophet] ''[[The Guardian]]'' 17 February 2008</ref> The site's [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Muhammad/FAQ answers to frequently asked questions about these images] state that Wikipedia does not censor itself for the benefit of any one group.<ref>[http://www.informationweek.com/news/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=206106192 Wikipedia Refuses To Delete Picture Of Muhammad] ''[[Information Week]]'' 7 February 2008.</ref>
